intro: Maytenus apurimacensis var. trollii, commonly known as the Apurímac mayten, is a shrub or small tree native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by small, fleshy fruits that are edible. It thrives in humid, temperate climates and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially vulnerable species.
